text: Nagoya City Museum Interior into one of the exhibits The is a museum of the city of Nagoya in Aichi Prefecture, Japan. The Nagoya City Museum was established in 1977. Its collection includes archaeological materials, fine art, crafts, documents, books and folk materials including samurai armor and weaponry, many of which are put on exhibition. It also owns a collection of rare Kawana ware.https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Aichi_Prefectural_Ceramic_Museum_(9).jpg In addition to the permanent exhibition of the history of the Owari Domain starting from the Paleolithic period, special exhibitions and thematic exhibitions take place around every five to seven years, such as the one on Gandhara in 2003. A memorandum of understanding and cooperation was signed in January 2000 with the Vienna Museum, establishing it as a partner museum.https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Nagoya_City_Museum_%284%29.JPG The nearest stop by subway is Sakurayama Station on the Sakura-dōri Line. == References == == External links == * Homepage of the Nagoya City Museum Category:Museums in Nagoya Category:History museums in Japan
title: Nagoya City Museum
